abstract: Federal Communications Commission chairman Tom Wheeler is expected to propose regulating Internet service as telecommunications service, instead of an information service; move to treat service like public utility will almost certainly spark new debate and lobbying about how to guarantee so-called net neutrality.
lead_paragraph: Tom Wheeler, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, is expected to propose reclassifying high-speed Internet as a telecommunications service.

headline.main: In Net Neutrality Push, F.C.C. Is Expected to Propose Regulating Internet Service as a Utility
headline.print_headline: Utility-Type Oversight for Web Is F.C.C. Aim

snippet: Tom Wheeler, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, is expected to propose reclassifying high-speed Internet as a telecommunications service.
